revised_title: Foetal Membranes and Placenta of the Elephant: Implications for Mammalian Classification
tldr: The author examines the foetal membranes and placenta of the elephant, discovering unique features that challenge the traditional classification of mammals based on placental structures. The elephant's placenta combines both annular and diffused forms, which are typically found in distinct groups of mammals. This finding suggests that relying on placental characteristics alone may not accurately represent the true evolutionary relationships within the mammalian class.
